text:
Bright, spacious coffeeshop near the mrt. But the price for my ayataka green tea canned drink was ridiculously priced at $1.80☠️

Hokkien mee presentation is full marks but taste wise, it lacked wok hei. They were very generous with the ingredients even tho we ordered the small portion! Bak Chor mee tasted ok but only two meatballs…

Craving for authentic Hokkien Mee satisfied after visiting CCK blk 302 foodhouse. The noodle is a mixture of thick and thin, sauce is rich and flavourful - mixed with generous amount of pork/prawn/egg. Value for money.
Look for best Bak Cho Mee in CCK, the Google search prompt me this place. Not bad noodle taste good, $4.50.  But coffee black kosong costs $1.40 kind of more expensive than my place at Amk.

The noodle stall is something else. It's $5 and total worth it. The chilli has a unique taste to it. I would come back to eat again soon.

The Mala was great, worth the portion size of $20. Best to come late at night to avoid the crowds.

Has nice Fried Hokkien Mee ($6 a plate, 1 pax).

Nice Ngoh Hiang too - and for a Ngoh Hiang Platter, one should be well aware the cost can add up quickly if more items are selected.....
